title: What are some cool facts about grunge music? - Quora

response.answer_text: The story of Jason Everman. Born in Alaska in 1967, Jason Everman joined Nirvana as a guitarist in February of 1989, shortly after ‘Bleach’ was recorded (he did not play on the album but appears on the cover). Everman went on tour in ‘89 to support the ‘Bleach’ release, and can be seen and heard on some bootlegs from the era. Amid tensions within the band, a remaining portion of the tour was canceled and Everman left the band around July of ‘89. Shortly after, Soundgarden’s bassist Hiro Yamamoto left the band, and after auditioning, Jason Everman was Soundgarden’s new bassist, just in time for Soundgarden’s rigorous touring schedule of that time, criss-crossing North America and Europe. Following the tour, Everman was dismissed from Soundgarden after identity tensions developed. After a couple years of playing in a couple bands (OLD, and Mind Funk), Everman, who had always had interest in the military, left music to join up in 1993. Everman went on to serve in the US Army’s 2nd Ranger Battalion, moving on to serve in the Special Forces. Everman was honorably discharged in 2006. That wasn’t enough for this legend, as he earned a degree from Columbia University in philosophy in 2013. Now, Everman plays music in a band of military veterans known as Silence & Light. So this man, Jason Everman, was in Nirvana, Soundgarden, served his country honorably, and is now a degree holder from a prestigious university and makes great music. What a legend. And what a story. His story.
